description.narrative: The Corporación Universitaria Minuto de Dios - UNIMINUTO (Uniminuto) founded in 1990 and managed by the Eudist Catholic community is the largest private higher education institute in Colombia in number of students and national footprint (multi-campus). It offers traditional face-to-face, distance and virtual learning modalities mainly to low-income population (68% of its student base in the lowest two income strata out of six levels, and 98% in the lowest three levels), predominantly women (70% of total students), most of them family heads. The proposed investment will partly finance Uniminutos 2022-2025 strategic plan consisting of expansion CAPEX for new campuses, technology investments associated with the digital transformation agenda, academic and institutional strengthening, and social innovation programs (the Project).

The project will support the provision of high-quality education into lower-income rural areas and the companys digital strategy through D4TEP. The most significant expected project-level outcome is an increase in access to high-quality and affordable tertiary education. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates that its financing could support greater market competitiveness and inclusiveness driven by the rise in quality standards in low-cost education models and the introduction of best practices in online programs.
